title: 111_hr3857
content: The Act is titled the "Nonappropriated Fund Equity Act" and addresses the creditability of service. The "Nonappropriated Fund Equity Act" allows individuals with 5 or more years of civilian service to receive credit for service performed between December 31, 1965, and January 1, 1987. Employees can deposit an amount equal to deductions from basic pay for this service. Employees or Members can make a deposit to receive full retirement credit for past service. If the full deposit is not made, the resulting annuity will be reduced. Survivors can also make the deposit for survivor annuities. The Office will accept appropriate certifications. Employees or Members can make a deposit to receive full retirement credit for past service. The Office will accept certifications from the appropriate Secretary regarding service and compensation. An individual cannot receive credit for the same service under another retirement system. Applications for retirement credit must be submitted within 2 years of the effective date. The Office of Personnel Management will prescribe regulations within 12 months of the enactment of the Act to apply amendments for employees or Members entitled to an annuity under specific conditions. The amendment made by subsection (a) applies to annuity entitlement based on separation from service after the effective date of prescribed regulations, with a limited exception for annuities based on separations before the effective date. Upon receipt of an appropriate application before the deadline, the Office of Personnel Management will recompute the annuity amount for individuals entitled to an annuity based on separation from service after the enactment of the Act and before the effective date of regulations, if their annuity would be increased by section 8332(p) of title 5, United States Code. Upon receipt of an application, the Office of Personnel Management will adjust annuity amounts for individuals eligible under section 8332(p) of title 5, United States Code. Any changes will only apply to amounts accruing after the application date. SEC. 3. NOTIFICATION AND ASSISTANCE. The Office of Personnel Management is required to notify individuals entitled to service credit or recomputation under section 8332(p) of title 5, United States Code. They must also assist individuals in obtaining necessary information from government agencies for verification purposes. The Office of Personnel Management must assist individuals in obtaining information from government agencies regarding their service credit under section 8332(p) of title 5, United States Code. Other U.S. agencies must provide this information upon request from the individual or the Office of Personnel Management.
